image.altText: A man holding a pipe connected to sewage truck.

props.synopsis: More than 700 homes in the townships of Angle Vale, Virginia, Roseworthy and the suburb of Riverlea are having their sewage transported up to 40 kilometres by road to Adelaide's main wastewater treatment plant.

title.children: Sewage stored in pits and tankered out daily — South Australia's festering housing problem

image.altText: Illuminated light bulb strands

props.synopsis: Australia's power market operator says the outlook has improved for the country's biggest grid, but the risks of delays to new projects loom large.

title.children: Immediate threat of summer blackouts eases but market operator warns risks remain

image.altText: A man in a green hat leaning against a fuel pump

props.synopsis: Regional general store owners say they love their jobs, but with rising pressures there are concerns whether there'll be anyone willing to take on the challenge when they sell up.

title.children: The corner store is 'a lifestyle, not a job' for these proprietors who fear being left behind

image.altText: Carp fishing

props.synopsis: Australian researchers and chef Duncan Welgemoed are advocating for the pest species to be used to feed into health and beauty products in a multi-billion-dollar industry.

title.children: Why a top chef wants you to put carp collagen on your face

image.altText: An old stone building with a red dome

props.synopsis: A "devious" Adelaide woman who stole millions from the savings and super accounts of elderly victims, using some of the funds on hire cars and hotels, has not revealed what she did with all of the money, a court has heard.

title.children: 73yo 'con artist' swindled millions from vulnerable elderly victims in 'shocking' scheme, court told

image.altText: Close up of small furry animal

props.synopsis: Poison-laced food used to kill rabbits is being distributed in a region where work is underway to restore the population of an endangered species equally susceptible to the bait.

title.children: Poison-laced carrots 'a risk' to endangered bandicoots in Adelaide Hills

image.altText: Boxes of vapes stacked next to each other on display

props.synopsis: The South Australian government introduces legislation to state parliament that would grant it powers to send children into businesses to check if vapes are being illegally sold to minors.

title.children: Vaping crackdown could involve 'sting operations' in which children are sent undercover into shops

image.altText: Gemma Houghton holds a footy while leaning on a railing in the stands looking away

props.synopsis: Two-time All Australian Gemma Houghton says her passion for football ran dry after her mate's death, as a study has found female athletes face more psychosocial stressors including exposure to sexual harassment and challenges around parenting.

title.children: 'Everyone struggles': AFLW star speaks out about mental health after losing best friend to suicide

image.altText: A Kombi Van covered with lights

props.synopsis: A Port Adelaide couple used their not-for-profit Kombi to entertain people isolated in their homes during pandemic restrictions and now it's up for sale.

title.children: 'Benji' the Kindness Kombi to embark on new chapter after bringing light during COVID-19 restrictions

props.synopsis: Kidnapped from his Burkina Faso home at gunpoint in 2016, Ken Elliott survived seven years in the desert as a prisoner of Al Qaeda.

title.children: Australian doctor who survived seven years in the desert as a prisoner of Al Qaeda speaks for the first time

image.altText: Anthony Albanese holding a takeaway coffee laughs with Kurt Campbell.

props.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese has bridled at questions from journalists about a private conversation where he joked with US Deputy Secretary of State Kurt Campbell about splitting the cost of the Pacific Policing Initiative announced yesterday in Tonga.

title.children: Albanese caught on camera joking about Pacific policing plan with top US official

image.altText: A man's legs, wearing a military uniform and boots, standing on a flag on the ground.

props.synopsis: A former Wagner Group mercenary sheds light on the organisation's inner workings, as well as its training and recruitment procedures as the private army announces it has pulled out of Ukraine.

title.children: Former Wagner soldier details horrors of Putin's 'meat grinder' as group pulls out of Ukraine

image.altText: CFMEU MEMBERS RALLY BRISBANE

props.synopsis: Affiliation and donations to the ALP have been suspended, administrators forced in, and now Labor is using the bad stench around the CFMEU as a political weapon against the Greens.

title.children: A Greens MP's CFMEU antics call up memories of Tony Abbott standing in front of 'Ditch the Witch' placards

image.altText: A photo of a Qantas plane flying in the sky.

props.synopsis: Qantas has recorded a 28 per cent fall in its post-tax profit to $1.25 billion in the 2024 financial year, driven by fares moderating, increased spending on customer initiatives and reduced freight revenue.

title.children: Qantas posts fall in its post-tax profit to $1.25b, as chief executive says 'there's more work to do' to restore trust

image.altText: Woman and man in black suit talk at desk with microphones.

props.synopsis: ASX tipped to open lower, Qantas records large fall in profits as a parliamentary banking inquiry begins. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: Commonwealth Bank, Westpac face questioning in parliamentary inquiry

image.altText: Richard Marles National Press Club speech

props.synopsis: The defence minister requested a second office be opened for ministerial duties, just a three-minute walk from his electorate office.

title.children: Defence Minister Richard Marles opened $600k second office despite already having one three minutes away

image.altText: A soldier holding a big gun runs across a sandy road in front of an armoured vehicle.

props.synopsis: At least nine Palestinians have been killed in Israeli raids and strikes on several towns in the north of the occupied West Bank, according to a Red Crescent spokesperson.

title.children: Nine Palestinians killed in Israeli raids and strikes on West Bank, humanitarian workers say

image.altText: A man looks up wearing a black hat, glasses and a blue long sleeve shirt.

props.synopsis: The nine-month-old baby was with his family at Hanlon Park around midday on Tuesday, when it's alleged an unknown man approached them and poured hot liquid on the baby.

title.children: Police release new photos in search for man after hot coffee poured on baby at Brisbane park

image.altText: Aivi Luik walks in a tracksuit

props.synopsis: Matildas star Aivi Luik saw her world crash down around her after being found guilty of a doping violation before the Paris Olympics. She wants to use her experience as a warning to other athletes.

title.children: 'It made my heart drop': Matildas star warns other athletes after revealing doping ban

image.altText: Madison de Rozario and Brenden Hall march with the Australian flag

props.synopsis: Paris comes alive once more, as the 17th Paralympic Games are set to open with the Opening Ceremony at the Place de la Concorde and along the Champs-Elysées.

title.children: Paralympics opening ceremony a wave of colour in Paris as Australians add to Champs-Elysées party — as it happened

image.altText: High waves are observed along the shore as a typhoon approaches.

props.synopsis: A typhoon lashes southern Japan with torrential rain and strong winds, causing at least three deaths as it starts a crawl up the length of the archipelago and raises concerns of flooding, landslides and extensive damage.

title.children: Typhoon Shanshan makes landfall in Japan, leaving three dead and several injured

image.altText: A graduate holds on to his hat while talking on his mobile phone

props.synopsis: The federal government's proposal to cap international student enrolments has prompted dire warnings from parts of the sector about the economic fallout.

title.children: Universities warn international student cap could slash numbers further than intended

image.altText: A pair of pink ski on a grassy hill, snow-covered mountains in the background

props.synopsis: The recent hot spell may feel unfamiliar, but weather extremes are quickly becoming the norm, as climate change up-ends the winter seasons.

title.children: As Australia basks in sunshine, ski fields turn to sludge in heatwave labelled a 'hot mess' by climate scientists

image.altText: Wieambilla hideout

props.synopsis: A marathon five-week inquest into the devastating Wieambilla shootings, which claimed the lives of two young police officers and an innocent neighbour, has reached its final day.

title.children: Paranoia, hideouts and 'the Rubicon': What we've learned from the Wieambilla shooting inquest

image.altText: Portrait picture of a woman with long dark hair cupping her chin in her hand.

props.synopsis: A 63-year-old grandmother who went missing in February this year has been identified after her skeleton was found near a beach four months later.

title.children: Missing Queensland grandmother's remains found 800km from home on NSW Mid North Coast beach

image.altText: Poh Ling Yeow

props.synopsis: The celebrity chef speaks about her life almost lived as a Mormon housewife, and the one guilty secret meal she relishes making.

title.children: 'None of this would have happened': Poh Ling Yeow on the decision that changed her life

image.altText: a hand holding a phone with a bank card pulled up

props.synopsis: Neobanks are online-only branches, and experts are concerned they could be more susceptible to scammers.

title.children: Digital banks are 'a gift' for scammers. Here's what you need to know to keep your savings safe

image.altText: Alexei Popyrin clenches his fist

props.synopsis: Australia's tennis aces have made their best start to the US Open in 45 years, with Alexei Popyrin continuing his excellent run. But Rinky Hijikata, Ajla Tomljanovic and Maya Joint have all crashed out on day three.

title.children: Popyrin powers through as other Aussies falter at US Open

image.altText: People wearing winter gear looking at equipment

props.synopsis: The permafrost is melting and scientists are racing to collect ancient viruses trapped in the ice to understand how they’ve adapted to shifting climate over millennia.

title.children: Scientists discover 1,700 new  'zombie' viruses in ancient permafrost in the Himalayas

image.altText: A man sits inside a home looking very unhappy.

props.synopsis: Richard Hamilton signed a contract in 2020 for Nicheliving to build him a new home. It's still unfinished, and now the troubled builder is selling a house he had been renting from them while he waited.

title.children: Nicheliving customer left waiting four years for his house now facing homelessness

image.altText: A white man wearing all black speaks with an ear microphone and his hands out

props.synopsis: The tech billionaire is barred from leaving France while investigations into child abuse material and drug trafficking on the platform continue.

title.children: Telegram boss facing preliminary charges in France after arrest

image.altText: Donald Trump is shielded by secret service as blood spreads from an injury on his ear

props.synopsis: The FBI says Thomas Matthew Crooks spent months looking into both the Republican and Democratic parties, including their national conventions, before settling on Donald Trump as a target for a shooting.

title.children: Trump rally shooter sought information on Donald Trump and Joe Biden before settling on target

image.altText: Hughenden caravan park

props.synopsis: An 18-year-old man has faced court charged with stealing a caravan which had a family of five still inside it.

title.children: Man arrested after bizarre theft of caravan with family inside at outback holiday park

image.altText: A young girl shoots a basketball on an indoor court

props.synopsis: After-school activities can offer physical and mental health benefits, improved resilience and better academic performance, but how can families balance these with the time and financial costs?

title.children: Extracurricular activities have many benefits for children, but not everyone has access
